data.text: You come across a pristine-looking water fountain that has been cordoned off with caution tape and a crude sign reading "gLOWy watER". You presume the gremlins are responsible for the poor handwriting.
Indeed, when you push the button, the fountain's water appears to shine with faint radiance. That's probably not good, but some risk-taking part of you suggests it might be magical.

text: You take a cautious sip. It tastes like normal water, but seconds later, your head feels fuzzy.
Pain lances through your mind and your body shimmers briefly. After a few moments, the sensations fade and you're left with nothing but the echoes of a headache and a lingering sense of confusion.
You leave the fountain alone and continue on your way.
